column4: i partitioned a drive as one big partition and now when ubuntu boots it says special drive sda not found ...any ideas?
everything seems fine except for that error...
can you paste the output of sudo fdisk -l && cat /etc/fstab on paste.ubuntulinux.nl
someone told me yesterday it was becaues of the way the drive was partitionee
when does it give this error, on boot..?
yes
so you cannot boot..?
i can boot fine....it just gives the error...the drive is an empty formatted drive
i have 3 drives.....1x40gb  2x200gb
are the old paritions still in /etc/fstab perhaps?
Linux is on the 40gb....the 200's are to be partitioned and then raieded
dont think so ...its a fresh install of ubuntu
i was told I had to partition the drive a way other than one whole device.....
you're back
no i am not
oh ..ok
that is the product of your imagination ;)
any idea what is going on with my drives with the special device not found err
no, you still didn't tell me when exactly the error happened :)
any idea what is going on with my drives with the special device not found err
have you tried the wiki?
I've tried everything...
http://wiki.ubuntu.com
